The correct answer is C: Only the title "Potential Sources of Conflict" with green "Circumstances" and white "Principles" boxes is shown.
This can be determined by listening to the audio at the time the cash register sound plays (around 7.89 seconds), which reveals that only the title of the section is displayed on the screen. The other options describe different visual elements that appear at different times in the video.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on philosophy for help. The sentence in the audio indicates that where there is free market competition, consumers have power over what they buy and produce because firms producing goods or services that do not meet their preferences will go bankrupt.

Therefore, the answer is (B).
